member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IIncomingMessageInterceptor
member.summary:
A message interceptor for incoming messages.
Messages are intercepted before they reach the registered message handler.
This mechanism can be used, eg, to read headers in incoming messages, in a transparent manner.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IIncomingMessageInterceptor.InterceptMessage``1(EasyNetQ.IMessage{``0},EasyNetQ.MessageReceivedInfo,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Intercepts incoming messages before they reach the registered message handler.
member.typeparam: The type of the received message.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IIncomingMessageInterceptor`1
member.typeparam: The subclass of for which the has being registered.
member.remarks: Type parameter can be used to differentiate between the various implementations that have been registered with dependency injection.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.INackWithoutRequeueException
member.summary: When thrown from a consumer's handler, a NACK will be sent for the message to the RabbitMQ server but the message will not be requeued.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.INackWithRequeueException
member.summary: When thrown from a consumer's handler, a NACK will be sent for the message to the RabbitMQ server and the message will be requeued.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IOutgoingMessageInterceptor
member.summary:
A message interceptor for outgoing messages.
Messages are intercepted before they are sent to the RabbitMQ server.
This mechanism can be used, eg, to inject headers to outgoing messages, in a transparent manner.

member.typeparam: The subclass of for which the has being registered.
member.remarks: Type parameter can be used to differentiate between the various implementations that have been registered with dependency injection.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig
member.summary: The RabbitMQ related configuration section which contains all the necessary details for connecting to the RabbitMQ server.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.Id
member.summary:
Provides a way to name a RabbitMQ configuration in order to provide connection reusability.
When the same is used for multiple consumers and/or producers, then all of them will use the same and thus, the same connection to the RabbitMQ server.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.HostName
member.summary: The RabbitMQ server hostname to connect to.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.Port
member.summary: The RabbitMQ server port to connect to.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.VirtualHost
member.summary: The RabbitMQ virtual host to use when connecting to the RabbitMQ server.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.UserName
member.summary: The username with which to connect to RabbitMQ.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.Password
member.summary: The password with which to connect to RabbitMQ.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.RequestedHeartbeat
member.summary: The connection heartbeat in seconds.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.ReconnectionAttemptInterval
member.summary: The interval with which to try to reconnect, once disconnected.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.PersistentMessages
member.summary: For producers, whether to use persistent messages when sending a message.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.PublisherConfirms
member.summary: For producers, whether to use RabbitMQ's Publisher Confirms feature.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.MessageDeliveryTimeout
member.summary: For producers, it sets the timeout for publishing a message to the RabbitMQ server.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.PublisherLoopErrorBackOffMilliseconds
member.summary:
For the default producer implementation, the back off delay when an error occurs in the producer's loop.
For details about the producer's queue, see .

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig.Copy
member.summary: Makes easy reusing a .

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.DependencyInjection.RabbitMqServiceBuilder`1
member.summary: This class implements the builder pattern for subclasses of .
member.typeparam: The consumer or producer subclass of .

example.code: // in the configuration callback of new RabbitMqServiceBuilder<MyRabbitMqService>() .WithRabbitMqConfig(rabbitMqConfig) .Build(services) .Add(services, typeof(MyInjectedRabbitMqServiceType), typeof(MyInjectedRabbitMqServiceOptionalExtraType))

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.DependencyInjection.RabbitMqServiceBuilder`1.WithStronglyTypedMessages
member.summary:
Enable .
For consumers, it means that each incoming message is expected to have a valid type property, pointing to an available type in a FULL_TYPE_NAME, ASSEMBLY_NAME format, in order to deserialize the message into that type.
For producers, it means that the message will be sent along with a valid type property in a FULL_TYPE_NAME, ASSEMBLY_NAME format.

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.DependencyInjection.RabbitMqServiceBuilder`1.WithCorrelationIds
member.summary: When set, producers will send a correlation id along with each message.

member.summary: Adds a callback to run each time the is connected to the RabbitMQ server.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.DependencyInjection.RabbitMqServiceBuilder`1.OnConnectedOnce(EasyNetQ.HostedService.OnConnectedCallback)
member.summary:
Adds a callback to run each time the is connected to the RabbitMQ server.
The callback is wrapped into a closure that makes sure that the callback is run only once.

It reuses an existing singleton, if one is found using the provided .
If not, a new singleton is registered in the service factory wrapped by the .

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Internals.TypedMessageSerializationStrategy
member.summary:
An override for the default EasyNetQ implementation of .
It uses a to deserialize the message's type from the RabbitMQ message's type property.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Internals.UnhandledMessageTypeException
member.summary: Thrown when a consumer's default handler for is run, since that means that no other consumer handler matched the message type.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.Internals.UntypedMessageSerializationStrategy
member.summary:
An override for the default EasyNetQ implementation of .
It omits checking for the RabbitMQ message's type property, thus handling all messages as having a type of .

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqConsumer`1
member.summary:
The subclasses of RabbitMqConsumer<T> are hosted services that can be registered through dependency injection.
For a convenient way to inject such a consumer hosted service, see .
Using , allows one to inject such a consumer as RabbitMqConsumer<T>.
member.typeparam: The subclass of RabbitMqConsumer<T> that will be registered as a consumer through dependency injection.
member.remarks: Any required services can be injected through constructor parameters as with any other hosted service.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqProducer`1.EnqueueMessage(EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqProducer{`0}.Message)
member.summary:
Enqueues a message to be sent by the producer.
This method is called by .
member.remarks:
One can override this method to provide an alternative mechanism for enqueuing the messages.
If this method is overriden, should also be overriden.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqProducer`1.DequeueMessage(EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqProducer{`0}.Message@)
member.summary:
Dequeues a message to be sent by the producer.
This method is called by by the producer's message loop thread.
member.returns: Returns True if a message was successfully dequeued, False otherwise.
member.remarks:
One can override this method to provide an alternative mechanism for dequeuing the messages.
If this method is overriden, should also be overriden.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqProducer`1.OnCancellation
member.summary: This method is called by the producer's message loop thread, which started by , after cancellation has been requested on the with which has been called.

Expected to be overriden by consumers.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.OnConnectedCallback
member.summary: The callback type for callbacks that must run when a new connection is established to the RabbitMQ server.

member.name: T:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1
member.summary: A hosted service that accepts an EasyNetQ and uses it to either set up a consumer or a producer, given the configuration with which it has been created.
member.typeparam: The subclass of RabbitMqService<T> that will be registered as either a consumer or a producer through dependency injection.
member.remarks:
The purpose of this class is to gather the common concerns of handling an into a central place.
There are two provided, abstract derived classes, and .
The types that are to be registered with dependency injection, as consumers or producers, should derive one of these classes and potentially override the base class's functionality, as required.
Any required services can be injected through constructor parameters, in the derived class, as with any other hosted service.
For details and examples of the provided consumer and producer subclasses, please, see and .

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.Bus
member.summary: The initialized that is exposed to subclasses of .

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.RabbitMqConfig
member.summary: The populated that is exposed to subclasses of .

member.name: P:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.Logger
member.summary: The initialized that is exposed to subclasses of .

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.Create``1(System.Boolean,EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IBusProxy,EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig,System.Collections.Generic.List{EasyNetQ.HostedService.OnConnectedCallback},System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary:
This static method is used by to construct a singleton hosted service for a consumer of a producer.
Its purpose is to instantiate the TDerived, passing in the argument.
The services that can be injected this way are the ones that have been registered up to the call site of .
member.typeparam: The type of the consumer or producer that is being instantiated. It must match type parameter T of type .
member.returns: An instantiated which should be used to register a consumer or producer as a singleton hosted service.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.CreateLazyBus(EasyNetQ.HostedService.Abstractions.IRabbitMqConfig,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary:
This static method is used by to construct a singleton hosted service for a consumer of a producer.
Its purpose is to be used with so as to allow reuse of singletons
This is done in order to enable the use of the same or different connections to the RabbitMQ server, on demand.
For more information about how instances can be reused, see .

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.StartAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Starts the hosted service and initializes the consumer or producer by either setting up the consumption of messages or by starting the producer's message queueing functionality.
For details on the default implementations of consumers and producers, see and .

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.StopAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Stops the hosted service by first disposing of any IDisposable instances that are created during service startup.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.RegisterMessageHandlers(EasyNetQ.Consumer.IHandlerRegistration)
member.summary: This method must be provided by classes derived from , in order to provide a message handler per expected message type.
member.remarks: When the is used, then it only makes sense to provide a handler for the type.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.Initialize
member.summary: This virtual function is called right after the instantiation of the subclass of .
member.remarks: Overriding this function allows the subclass of to access fields that are initialized after the construction of the instance, eg, . .

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.InitializeConsumer(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This abstract function must be implemented by a subclass in order to initialize a consumer.
This is not called for producers and it's declared as abstract only to enforce its implementation by consumers.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.InitializeProducer(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This abstract function must be implemented by a subclass in order to initialize a producer.
This is not called for consumers and it's declared as abstract only to enforce its implementation by producers.

member.name: M:EasyNetQ.HostedService.RabbitMqService`1.AddDisposable(System.IDisposable)
member.summary: Adds a disposable into a common list of disposables in order to dispose of it on service termination.
